page.title: 11THE HOSPITAL IN LONGPRESTON
page.content: The Hospital,later referred to as"The Almshouses" and now known as Knowles Cottages,was built in accordance with the will of James Knowles made in 1613 and Letters Patent by James 1 in 1616.There were ten cottages for the poor of the ecclesiastical parish with a Chapel in the centre which the beneficiaries attended twice daily. The complex was entirely rebuilt in 1859 and about 1902 an office and treatment room for the District Nurse was added.This was later converted into a dwelling.There were outside toilets at each end of the block and a communal wash-house. The buildings were condemned by the District Council in 1960.
